title: Entity Deduplication Workflow
body_html:
Entity Deduplication Workflow

This page outlines a proposed workflow for handling entity deduplication within the Graphiti knowledge graph system.

Overview

  • A passive agent will continuously scan the knowledge graph for potentially duplicate entities.
  • Similarity metrics will be applied to entity attributes such as names, types, metadata, and contextual relationships.
  • Embedding-assisted similarity comparisons will be leveraged to improve detection accuracy.
  • Configurable thresholds will determine when to automatically merge duplicates vs. flag for manual review.
  • Audit trails and versioning will be maintained to allow rollback and traceability of merges.
  • Integration with the existing Bookstack-Graphiti syncing will help prevent duplicate event ingestion.
  • Performance will be optimized through batch processing and incremental scanning.
  • Admin interfaces will be provided for reviewing and managing ambiguous duplicates.

This workflow combines practical research insights with Graphiti's current capabilities to ensure efficient and reliable entity deduplication.
